57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:29): annevk5: are there any cases where returning "auto" from getComputedStyle is correct?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:30): looks around for scrollback
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:30): 57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13, e.g. for 'top'
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:31): annevk5: i'm looking at https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=43559. there's a case where WebKit returns 0px and Gecko returns auto
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:31): also for other things that are display:none or inside something display:none, I think
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:31): 57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13, the reason for that is because I aligned with WebKit; Gecko returns the used value there
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:32): 57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13, oh, that's the reverse
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:32): looks
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:32): it's getting the computed width/height on an uncached image
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:32): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, yeah, or where the property is in the special list and does not apply to the element
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:32): shift+reload http://tinyurl.com/24qmgck to see the difference

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:33): 57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13, I guess that is because in Gecko the image is treated as inline element so 'width' does not apply and therefore returns the computed value rather than the used value
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:34): oh, interesting.
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:34): 57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13, pretty sucky that pages can depend on how browsers generate boxes for replaced elements while loading :/
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:35): this sounds like a scary thing to change (for webkit or gecko) :(
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:35): sounds like an annoying thing to define too
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:35): i guess HTML5 should define that
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:36): checks the rendering chapter
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:38): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/complete/rendering.html#images-0 has the WebKit behavior
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:38): annevk5: i'm missing something. according to http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-values/#specified0, the computed value should never be "auto" no?
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:39): oh, nm
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (22:39): i misread

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:39): http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visudet.html#the-height-property "the percentage or 'auto' (see prose under <percentage>) or the absolute length; 'auto' if the property does not apply"
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:40): (and it does not apply with the Gecko <img> model; assuming I guessed all this correctly)
882504ee8a7b0921db5aaa16e95db40b (22:42): there is a Bug for that
882504ee8a7b0921db5aaa16e95db40b (22:42): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=321919

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (22:54): Hixie, if you're plain text file starts with a newline the parser would eat it

57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (23:37): 1. The bug reporter wants more identification of the meanings of a, b, etc.
